title: Taj Lake Palace
short_description: Originally built as a pleasure palace, this white marble wonder floats in the middle of Lake Pichola.
long_description:
Built in 1746 by Maharana Jagat Singh II as 'Jag Niwas', the Taj Lake Palace is one of the most romantic hotels in the world. Floating on the tranquil waters of Lake Pichola, this white marble palace was famously used as the lair of the Bond villain Octopussy, but its reality is far more serene.

The palace was restored to its pristine glory by the Taj Group, making it a benchmark for world-class hospitality and regal living. Every room offers breathtaking views of the neighbouring City Palace, Aravalli Hills, Machla Magra Hills, and Jag Mandir. The custodians of the palace, the Royal Butlers, are descendants of the original palace retainers and provide a service that is both discreet and impeccable.

Staying here is not merely about luxury; it is about inhabiting a piece of Mewari history. Guests arrive by private boat, are showered with rose petals upon entry, and can dine on platform floats in the middle of the lake. It is a fairy-tale experience that seamlessly blends the grandeur of the past with modern comforts.

room_types.name: Luxury Room
room_types.description: Elegant rooms offering views of the City Palace or the lake, adorned with traditional decor.

room_types.name: Palace Room
room_types.description: Spacious rooms with intricate detailing and expanded lake views.

room_types.name: Royal Suite
room_types.description: Opulent suites that have hosted royalty, featuring distinct living areas and rich historical tapestries.

event_spaces.name: Mewar Terrace
event_spaces.notes: Stunning views of the City Palace

opening_hours.time_notes: Hotel is open 24/7 for guests. Visitors require prior reservation for dining.

operating_season.season_notes: Best enjoyed in winter. Summers can be hot.

days.title: Arrival & Sunset
activities: Sunset Boat Cruise on Lake Pichola

heritage_history: Built between 1743 and 1746 under the direction of the Maharana Jagat Singh II, the 62nd successor to the royal dynasty of Mewar, as a summer palace. It was built facing east to allow its inhabitants to pray to the Sun god at dawn.
conservation_notes: Maintained meticulously by the Taj Group in partnership with the royal family, ensuring eco-friendly practices on the lake.
cultural_responsibility: Employing local artisans and sourcing ingredients locally to support the Udaipur community.
how_to_reach: Guests arrive at the City Palace jetty and are ferried by private hotel boat to the island palace.

pricing_metadata.disclaimer: Prices fluctuate by season and availability.

seo_title: Taj Lake Palace Udaipur - Floating Palace Hotel | Official Info
seo_description: Book your stay at Taj Lake Palace, Udaipur. Experience world-class luxury in a 18th-century marble palace floating on Lake Pichola.
